author: {'steamid': '76561198004120981', 'num_games_owned': 9074, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1705582842}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
A basic yet fun and challenging strategy time management game.

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Simple fun

[b]Cons[/b]
- Dated graphics
- Feels like a phone game

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Kingdom Tales isn't the best looking game considering it came out awhile back but it makes up for it in it's gameplay. Its a fun though rather basic but still challenging strategic management style game, if you're into quick time management then this really fits the bill.

[b]Story[/b]
The games story is quite basic doing the hero path but its really inconsequential, mostly its there to throw in extra objectives for some levels and gives you a premise to push on.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Most of the gameplay involves assessing the layout of levels and deciding what buildings to build for each available plot, this is important to finish objectives faster and easier as your workers need to travel there and back. The other important aspect is keeping track of your buildings and resources as these could cause bottlenecks. The last is simply clicking things fast enough, where if your buildings are ready you need to press a big button to tell your workers to go there. I'm assuming this is a port of a phone game since this is very akin to mechanics used in phone games.
The game is simple casual fun, it's not trying to be more than it needs to be and it's done decently well.

[hr][/hr]
If you find my reviews useful do follow my [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/11028547-Dods-Echo-Chamber/]Curator[/url][/b] page for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1679247890}
review:
Spielwertung: 8/10
Spielzeit: ca. 5 Stunden
Spieldurchläufe: 1 (Ende, entspannt)

Ich kann die negativen Wertungen nicht verstehen. Das Spiel ist kindgerecht, unterkomplex, entspannend und fehlerlos.

Ich habe 2 bedeutende Anschuldigungen gegen das Spiel gelesen und bringe selbst noch ein paar ein:

1. Microtransactions: Ich weiß zwar nicht, was bei Release oder sonst wann war, aber Stand 2023 ist das Spiel 100% frei von irgendwelchen Sachen, die man kaufen kann (und die ganze Oberfläche sieht auch nicht danach aus. Das Spiel macht überhaupt keinen Sinn mit so was, da man sowieso nichts dauerhaft behält. Ein Level geht im Durchschnitt 10 Min, auch da wäre "extra-Speed" kaum hilfreich. 
2. Langweilig / Handygame / Kopie von anderen Titeln: Auch hier: Keine Ahnung, ob das Spiel eine Kopie ist oder nicht, aber der Rest? Ja, das Spiel ist unterkomplex. Man könnte auch sagen, es richtet sich gezielt an die Zielgruppe 8-12 Jahre. Adoleszente oder Erwachsene dürften schwer unterfordert sein. Aber hier liegt auch der Schlüssel: Man kann in diesem Spiel prima Abschalten, gibt es doch nicht umsonst einen "Entspannungsmodus" (der sich vom 2. nur vom Faktor "Zeit" unterscheidet) Eine Person hat es hier bei den Rezensionen richtig beschrieben: 2-3 Missionen, ne Tasse Tee/Kaffee, entspannt. Was man daran auszusetzen hat? Die Leute erwarten vielleicht einfach ständig "Action" oder hochkomplexe Aufbautitel a la "Siedler" oder "Anno". Davon ist dieses Spiel MEILEN entfernt. 
3. Mein Punkt wäre der Preis: (Noch immer) wollen die Verkäufer standesgemäß knapp 10 € für den Titel haben. Ein stolzer, imo ZU hoher Preis. Andererseits gibt es ständig Sales. Aktuell ist der Titel für 2 noch was zu haben. Fair. 

Aber was ist Kingdom Tales denn nun?

In einem Satz: Eine Wanderung eines fiktiven Fantasy-Königs mit seinem Hofstaat von Punkt X (Hauptstadt) bishin zu den "Drachen", wo man "Frieden" schließen will. Auf unserer Reise müssen wir u.a. durch den "Feenwald", kommen bei den "Ogern" vorbei usw. usf. 

Das Spiel beginnt etwas fürchterlich. Die Graphik des Intro-Cinematics lässt einen die Zehennägel aus Fremdscham hochstehen. Auch alles andere ist grausig. Aber zum Glück weiß die Ingame-Graphik danach alles wieder gutzumachen.

Wir haben 45 Level vor uns. 
- In jedem Level gibt es feste Aufgaben zu erfüllen. Das können mal "Sammle 300 Gold" oder "Entferne 5 Spinnen" sein. 
- Wir haben immer eine einzige Bildschirmkarte, die sich nicht vergrößern/bewegen lässt. 
- Es stehen immer eine feste Anzahl an Bauplätzen zur Verfügung. 
- Unser Repertoire an "Gebäuden" erweitert sich stets, immer aber gilt: Jedes Haus braucht einen Brunnen (und später einen Hof), außerdem kommen wir fast nie an einem Steinbruch/Holzlager umhin. Diese 3 Spots sind quasi immer da. Ab einem bestimmten Level brauchen wir auch wenigstens 1 Gebäude, dass "Magie" erzeugt, weil wir sonst die Flüche nicht aufheben können. 
- In jedem Level gibt es einen "Schatz", der zufällig Holz oder Gold enthält (Funkel in der Umgebung)
- Manchmal gibt es "Hindernisse" (Spinnen, Hexenmeister, Steine, Stämme etc.), die wir erst zerstören müssen, um den "Weg" freizuschalten.
- Jedes Level lässt sich mühelos neustarten. Das ist aber nur sehr selten nötig. Meistens, weil man zu gierig war, denn das Abreißen von Gebäuden gibt keine Materialien zurück
- Manche Level kann man auch "rushen", indem man nur die Ziele erfüllt. Das bedeutet: Man muss nicht immer alle "Hindernisse" beseitigen, alle Schatzhöhlen untersuchen oder alle Gebäudeplätze ausfüllen.

Das Spiel versucht später sogar komplexer zu werden, als es selbst ausgelegt für ist. 2 Beispiele:

1. Schatzhöhlen: Kosten immer 1000 Gold zu untersuchen. Ich habe fast immer eine "Niete" bekommen, also 0 Ertrag. Als es einmal doch "klappte" (Wahrscheinlichkeit ca. 20%), kamen "2000 Gold" dabei raus. Also das Doppelte. WoW. Da hätte man sich schon mehr von erwartet...
2. Marktplatz: Mal abgesehen davon, dass es ziemlich verwirrend/bescheuert ist, dass man 3 unterschiedliche Angebote für sein Holz bekommt, die keinen Sinn machen... (400 Holz 900 Gold, 430 Holz 840 Gold, 500 Holz 880 Gold) ist der Marktplatz für schnelles Gold eine gute Idee, Problem: Ihr habt fast nie den Bauplatz dafür. Häuser kaufen und so schnell wie möglich aufwerten ist immer die bessere Variante. 

Fazit: Ich habe das Spiel in 3 Schichten a 15 Level durchgespielt. Ja, zu jedem Ende hin wurde man müder und unaufmerksamer, ja, das Spiel ist wahrlich keine Herausforderung oder erzählt in irgendeiner Weise eine relevante Geschichte, aber es ist entspannend, hübsch und einfach "unbedeutend". Würde ich mir dieses Spiel für einen Zehner kaufen? Nö. Ich würde mir das Spiel überhaupt nicht kaufen. Aber als "Bundle-Freebie" hat es mich durchaus angenehm unterhalten. Es gab keine Abstürze, keine Ärgernisse, es ist einfach ein kleines, unschuldiges Spiel, nicht mehr und nicht weniger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1563984992}
review:
Kingdom Tales m'a laissé un peu sceptique pendant les 15 premières missions. La main d'oeuvre est illimitée, les temps paraissent plutôt larges; il n'y a qu'un seul matériau de construction et, à part en oubliant de construire un puits, il n'y a pas de risque de se planter. Je ressentais une expérience de clicker plus que de gestion de temps.
Heureusement vers la 15ème mission, le jeu se corse singulièrement avec plus de choses à faire et surveiller. Ca reste du casual répétitif pour tuer le temps, moins dense que d'autres jeux de ce genre (un Roads to Rome ou un Rescue Team me laissent le souvenir de plus d'intensité). Mais entre les objectifs plus variés et l'apparition d'une autre ressource critique, la magie pour contrer les malédictions, il devient plus délicat de tout surveiller et de répartir son attention entre les différentes tâches et équilibrages si l'on veut respecter le délai imparti.

Avis légérement positif passée la première impression. D'autant que je suis un bon client pour l'ambiance fantasy et que graphiquement je le trouve assez plaisant, même s'il ne sort pas de l'ordinaire. Il n'y a guère que la musique qui me saoule un peu. Pas bien grave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1661699243}
review:
Kingdom Tales is a mobile app that's been dumped lazily onto Steam as a cash grab from greedy mobile devs.  This is simple screen tapper/clicker game masquerading as a proper city building sim (think Settlers/The Guild etc).   This kind of low quality low effort casual mobile port doesn't belong on Steam.  

People who want to play these kinds of games can play them on mobile for free, or for a fraction of the exhorbitant price they're asking for a game that doesn't belong on PC anyway.  People who want to play a deeper, more proper city simulator can play one of those on PC.  Thumbs down for a mobile game on PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010597228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1690209423}
review:
Daumen hoch, aber nicht völlig zufrieden!
Aussagen mit "..." haben einen Verweis zu Contra mit gleicher Nr.

Pro:
1. einfach zu lernen...
2. viele Gebäude...
3. viele Missionen
4. Arbeiter auflevelbar, was sich später als ungemein nützlich erweist

Con: 
1. ... bietet wenig Herausforderung, da Level (meist) beim ersten Mal klappen
2.  ... die selten benötigt werden, meist baut man direkt das beste Haus was möglich ist, mit 1 oder später 2 Versorgungsgebäuden, das Gebäude zur Holzgewinnung und den Pavillon... die 3 billigeren Häuser, den Markt, das Gebäude mit dem reduzierten Nahrungsbedarf der Häuser und den ersten Magieturm baut man entweder garnicht mehr, oder nur, weil das bessere Gebäude anfangs noch nicht verfügbar ist. Einmal musste ich ein Anfangshaus bauen, einmal das Gebäude zur Verbesserung der Zufriedenheit... ergo, wenig Abwechslung und Planung nötig wie bei anderen Spielen
3. Story 0815
4. wenig verschiedene Ressourcen (Gold, Holz und Magie)
5. wenig Strategie erforderlich, Levelaufbau einfach zu durchschauen und selbst Fehler kann man einfach ausbessern

Fazit:

Nicht schlecht, aber im Vergleich zu anderen Spielen zu einfach - also für Spieler die eine Herausforderung wollen nicht zu empfehlen, für Spieler die gemütlich daddeln wollen auf jeden Fall einen Blick wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993032945', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1521133941}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135223', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1655043749}
review:
Bon petit jeu de gestion, dommage qu'il ne soit pas assez poussé et que l'on se retrouve très rapidement a toujours réaliser le même schéma de construction.
Il n'en demeure pas moins qu'il est amusant pour les quelques heures qu'il faut pour le finir.
Et la preuve qu'il est bien, j'attaque le n°2 afin de voir s'ils ont corrigés les défauts du premier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1497806566}
review:
Tags: Clicker - Cooldown
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Feels kiddish in tone and somewhat grating. Typical mechanics for the subgenre. Redundant.

Review: This is a ressource management game that is centered around the use of hotspots and cooldowns in which you constantly have to click to gather ressources, then use ressources in specialty shops to diversify your pool of ressources until you reach a quota pre-determined by the scenario. Each scenario introduce more diversity in terms of ressources but the core gameplay remains the same. You will have to spend ressources to remove obstacles from within the map. Actions are performed by a roster of workers that run in and out of your main castle onto the paths towards the hotspots. The audio and 2D sprites are not the absolute worst but they are pretty lackluster and feel cheap and strangely irritating, the whole thing is paper thin and extremely repetitive. There are better casual games of this type on Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561198025422531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1450026987}
review:
This is a totally avergae [i]casual[/i] time / resource management game. It's not a deep simulation game and doesn't pretend to be. It's not clear why some of the reviews on this game compare it to much deeper sim games. Not a really fair comparison.

Anyway, if you're familiar with this type of game, Kingdom Tales is a completely average entry. The graphics, sound and mechanics are all solid but nothing really special. There's barely anything here in terms of story or characters but it doesn't get in the way. There is very little challenge to be had in this game. I only needed a handful of level re-starts to get the best rating.

So, yes, if you're expecting the next Civilization or Settlers, you're looking at the wrong game. On the other hand, if you're looking for another solid, if unremarkable, entry in the causal time management genre, then I suppose you could do worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1393497101}
review:
Vorwort:

In "Kingdom Tales" übernimmst Du die Rolle eines unerschrockener Baumeisters. Du musst eine Wirtschaft aufzubauen, die dienlich für die Lösung vielfältiger Aufgaben ist. Denn neben einer gewissen Menge an Geld sind auch ausreichend Vorräte und zufriedene Bewohner gefragt, die der Grundstein für eine florierende Aufbautätigkeit sind. Deshalb muss der Spieler Gegenstände aus dem Weg räumen und Ruinen abtragen, Wohnhäuser bauen und Produktionsstätten errichten. Aber auch magische Gebäude werden gebraucht, die Magie produzieren, welche für die Heilung verfluchter Gebäude und das Entzaubern von verwandelten Arbeitern notwendig ist. Denn egal, in welchen der Level sich der Spieler auch bewegt, immer wieder wird er von fiesen Hexenmeistern überrascht, die zerstörerische Flüche aussprechen, um die Produktion zum Erliegen zu bringen.

Die Optik des Spiels kommt mit bunten Farben, vielfältig gestalteten Landschaften und wechselende Figuren daher. Du reist durch verschiedene Landschaften wie z.B. märchenhafte Wälder, heiligen Seen, gigantische Bergketten oder auch durch sagenumwobene Täler. Deine Aufage besteht darin, dass Du immer wieder deinen Ökonomen losschickst, der in den Häusern die Steuern eintreibt. Desweiteren muss er sich um Rohstoffnachschub und wichtige Nahrungsmittel kümmern und Sorge dafür tragen, dass Magier und Helden ihre Aufgaben erfüllen. Ein Spiel, das neben einer geschickten Einteilung vorhandener Ressourcen auch Schnelligkeit und einen gewissen Überblick vom Spieler verlangt, dafür aber viele kurzweilige Stunden am PC beschert.

Pro:

+ 45 abwechslungsreiche Level, die es zu meistern gilt
+ eine Vielzahl von Gebäuden, um dein Königreich zu erweitern
+ gute Grafik und Soundtrack
+ Einsteigerfreundlich

Kontra:

- Spielzeit con ca. 6 Stunden

Fazit:

"Kingdom Tales" ist ein hübsch anzusehendes und leicht zu spielendes Aufbau- und Strategiespiel, dass sich für alle Altersklassen gut eignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970064749', 'num_games_owned': 5549, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1431518756}
review:
If you buy indie bundles, you often get games you would not normally buy, Kingdom Tales surely is one of those games. 

Before playing, I pretty much knew what to expect. Kingdom Tales is a casual strategy game, you would expect on Facebook (but without the real payments ofcourse) or any browser game site. It's obvious, the developers targeted a young audience, so it may not be fair to review this as an adult. 

Kingdom Tales looks cute but other then that the game only consists of clicking on icons. There's no difficulty and does't require thinking. A lot of languages are included in the game, so if you got some young kids, they might have a blast with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003491718', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1426608424}
review: Its like a game that youd find on a flash site or on the app store in you phone, no complaints because i paid less than what you probably would on the phone £0.55 worth it for a few hours of game play. full price, maybe not. I would recommend this game at the price i got it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1424677459}
review: A really boring and repetitive game. It has the resource management of an RTS but without any of the unit building or fighting that makes those games fun. Even as you progress you unlock higher level buildings but they take more resources so you really aren't progressing because the start of each level you have to sit there with 1 building and just wait until you collect money 20 times and then you can slowly build more. All the game is is clicking to collect and build a gold, water, magic, or wood resource building. Every level is pretty much the exact same. Basically no story. This game feels like it was designed for facebook or free to play mobile app. I finally just got sick of it and gave up. 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006636652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1419983008}
review:
I love these kinds of games, nice to look at, fun story to explore, strategy and perhaps some RPG elements.
But this one isn't for me.

I want them to be a bit more "heavy" and for grown ups than this game is.
[list]
     [*]I'd love for it to be more RPG heavy, more story and upgrades and items and levels
     [*]It desperately needs less clicking, there is [b]a lot[/b] of clicking here
     [*]It's very repetitive in it's core mechanics, some more automation as you progress would go a long way
[/list]

I'm sure it's quite fun for a casual gamer or a kid, I just end up seeing how much i [i]could[/i] have liked it had it been more like lets say [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/12500/]Puzzle Quest[/url]

But it's a good game with nice music, awesome artwork and tons of levels, it's just not what i'd hope for.

If you want a casual game you can play a level or two of and then log off, or for your kid, i'd say it's a good catch especially as at the cheap price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059030203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1336, 'last_played': 1694908182}
review:
On level 38 of 45, and plan to finish it.

You do begin to learn a pattern to defeat each level, so some may find that boring, but I think it is just challenging enough to keep your attention without being frustrating.  

If "Fairygodmother Tycoon" and "Majesty 2" had a kid, it would be "Kingdom Tales".  If you liked either of those (or similar) games, you will enjoy this one as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144398171', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1419445334}
review:
“Um jogo que mais parece jogo para mobile.”

Kingdom Tales é um jogo de administração de recursos lançado em 2013 pela Cateia Games. O jogo te dá a missão de administrar um reino de modo que você consiga fazer todas as fases para salvá-lo dos ameaçadores dragões.

Kingdom Tales apresenta gráficos em HD e 2D muito semelhante aos jogos de celulares, nele você pode optar por jogar dois modos diferentes de jogo sendo um o modo aventura no qual você tem tempo para concluir as missões de cada fase e o modo relaxado no qual você termina a fase a hora que quiser. Cada fase te dá um certa quantidade de experiência que permite você subir de título, muito semelhante a subir de level em jogo de RPG.

A mecânica de Kingdom Tales é muito simples sendo inteiramente com a utilização do mouse. Em cada fase você dispõe de um mapa e a partir daí você deve cumprir seus objetivos administrando ouro, felicidade, magia e materiais de modo que consiga manter seu reino. Kingdom Tales não é nem um pouco desafiador ou difícil, fazendo com que o jogador não sinta aquela vontade de superar o game. O game também apresenta a falta de diálogos em áudio tendo apenas alguns diálogos escritos no início de cada fase. O áudio de Kingdom Tales é incriticável pois possui apenas alguns sons de quando clicamos em algumas estruturas e uma música de fundo que suaviza um pouco o tédio da jogatina, ou seja, não se esforçaram nem um pouco para utilizar recursos de áudio.

O fato do game apresentar apenas um modo de jogo também impõe uma limitação ao jogador no qual ele pode terminar todas as fases e recomeçar do zero de novo e assim por diante. Kingdom Tales não é um jogo ruim com bugs e erros ele é apenas um jogo que deve ser considerado como passatempo pois não apresenta nada de desafiador e nada de novo. Um ponto muito bom no game é o tutorial dele que é muito bem explicado e o fato de ele ser inteiramente em português.

Apesar de ser um game simples muito parecido com jogos de celulares eu recomendo para aquelas pessoas que são leigas em jogos que querem um jogo para passar um pouco do tempo já que ele roda em qualquer máquina e também recomendo para aqueles pais que querem entreter seus filhos pequenos dando a eles um jogo simples, intuitivo e muito fácil.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993115632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1411517637}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046227732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1417638684}
review:
Surprisingly, I have found myself addicted to this game. It's very simple, yet fun. It doesn't take any skill to play, though.
You go through levels, to win the level you build houses and cottages to generate money,
which you can then use to build resource buildings. You have an unlimited amount of workers, which makes it too easy, and basically all you do is click. I read somewhere that there were a few glitches in the game, so far I haven't noticed anything except for a typo. (hehe)
I give this game an 8.5/10 on the "this is so fucking chill and relaxing" metre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054813787', 'num_games_owned': 1794, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1522003926}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999390811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1408679279}

author: {'steamid': '76561198147927091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1409502771}
review:
I got this game as part of a bundle, so i can't complain too much as it's hardly left me out of pocket, however i feel sorry for anyone who has paid full price for this game. 

I'll confess it's not 100% garbage, i mean, i played the whole game through each level for about 5 hours, across a few days, but i spent the whole time just waiting for something more, but constantly feeling restrained as if there was very little choices to make and it was a very clear path to follow.

From the video preview i would say i enjoy games like this, i like the sort of management you get in games like this, and there was a slight notion it would be quite childish, however i held out in the hope that the game play would be a good way to satisfy my strategy cravings. 

As a base note this game was just nothing but disappointing and a little insulting. 

I wouldn't recommend this game to any adults... it's an older child's game if anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009356603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1610742182}
review:
edit: After a 2nd play through years later, this game isn't that bad for what it is. Because there really isn't a story and it isn't that long (3-4 hours maybe), Kingdom Tales feels like it best suited for a phone or tablet game.  It's definitely aimed at younger players new to resource/time management style games as it does a lot of hand holding.  For what it is, it's a good time waster as there is some challenge to it, but I wouldn't pay more than a couple of bucks for it.  Still can't recommend it though because it feels like a mobile game put on the desktop.

Babby's first RTS game.  pretty much a no brainer, low diff game that is 45 levels, and about 10 minute levels.  Recommended for the younger crowd, not experienced gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067585484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1409179995}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043198608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1408461332}
review:
Easy as a pie, short as your Johnson, pretty good music and sounds. Even though there are A LOT of negative reviews (which I've read after completing the game) I had some fun with the game. No, seriously. It feels like everybody is a winner in Kingdom Tales. The tasks are easy and the time management isn't THAT challenging (compared to other similar games).
Strong 6/10 for those of you who want a relaxing clone in this genre. Got it via bundle. No regrets. Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020067542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1410621542}
review: Un tipico gioco di gestione del tempo, dove perdere in sè è impossibile ma la vera vittoria viene dal completare gli obbiettivi entro un certo tempo. Il gameplay è roba già vista in giochi come build-a-lot or mykingdom for a princess: invii i tuoi lavoratori dalla tua base a costruire case, miniere ecc per raccogliere risorse e soddisfare gli obbiettivi della mappa. La grafica è colorata e pulita, anche se non spettacolare, mentre la trama è penosa.... ma non imbarazzante. Diciamo che si fa giocare: se lo trovate a poco (max 3-4€) può anche andare per partite di pochi minuti nelle pause di lavoro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028020795', 'num_games_owned': 6567, 'num_reviews': 502, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1393283784}
review:
First impressions: http://www.cublikefoot.com/kingdom-tales-first-impressions/

To say that Kingdom Tales is bad is quite the understatement. The game is absolute garbage.

Everything about the game is just… bad. I could not find any enjoyment in the title at all. The game feels more like a F2P Facebook game than an actual “game”. The game does do a good job with its graphics, music, and dialogue, but the gameplay is utterly terrible. The gameplay consists of time and resource management, that is all. It’s done in such a way that I couldn’t help but compare it to today’s Facebook games. All you have to do, as the player, is click and wait. This needs to be done over and over and over and over.

Can’t recommend the game, even if it were to go for $0.50. It’s simply not worth the bandwidth used by the game’s download, nothing else too it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966527290', 'num_games_owned': 3794, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1393025039}
review: "Kingdom Tales a beau être plutôt attrayant au premier abord, même si il est évident dès les premières secondes que nous avons à faire à des graphismes passe-partout déjà vus et revus, il n’en est pas moins extrêmement ennuyant et répétitif. Ce n’est pas parce que le grand public demande de la simplicité qu’il faut aller à l’extrême et enlever tout amusement à ce qu’on appelle un jeu vidéo. Cateia Games n’a rien compris de cela et nous sert une soupe maintes fois goûtées, jamais appréciée." GameSideStory.com http://www.gamesidestory.com/2014/02/25/gametest-kingdom-tales-pc-mac-ios-android/

author: {'steamid': '76561198025025501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1392595153}
review: I would not recommend this game for anyone over 8 years old or who has ever played a game of this general type. It is kind of pretty, but what other reviewers have said: there is no game here. If you want a game where no choices are available or want something appropriate for a not-terribly-bright six year old, this might be a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001046455', 'num_games_owned': 13195, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1392423685}
review:
Kingdom Tales is a casual time and resource management game where you build establishments to earn money and other resources to complete missions. It's rather mediocre but still enjoyable until you grow bored of the rules that only slightly change over the campaign. At least graphics are pretty and atmosphere is nice and fluffy. So, what about the game aspect?

Basically, in each mission you'll establish a production cycle that earns you money that is used to build special structures and cut stones (the other resource). Stone is used to build money generating buildings and other structures. Money is generated by clicking icons that pop up when the building has produced a patch of taxes. Then your tax collectors will rush to bring the gold back to the castle. Profit!

So the mechanics are very simple and repetitive and approaching dull. Most everything happens with one or two clicks. A naive story of getting friendly with the dragons runs along by completing the missions of each level. Missions range from gathering enough gold to killing all the wild animals and monsters (which simply costs money and/or mana that is a resource unlocked later) to building certain buildings and upgrades. While the mechanics are always the same, they are used in many ways within the story: early on you'll be saving the tree of life, helping some druids and loading up ships for a journey.

The full completion of the game takes only several hours: for me this was less than 5. The game is rather unchallenging. There are 9 in-game achievements that would be nice to see on Steam as well, but they are very easy to attain.

It's a decent, though rather short time waster. Though I initially recommended the game, I've decided to revoke my recommendation because of the utter repetitive nature of the game that becomes boring half-way through. It was somewhat worth its discounted price though because the story was so cute.

if you'd like to test the game out anyway, a demo is available at bigfishgames.com:
http://www.bigfishgames.com/download-games/23538/kingdom-tales/index.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198005441308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1392333522}
review:
Gameplay is linear and uninspired.  It looks nice enough but the whole strategy boils down to clicking on buttons to collect resources, building placement on predefined plots, and resource and time management.  The resource gathering forces you to click icons when they appear, that otherwise in most games is automated.  You even need to click a button to have them get water when they are thirsty.

Enemies are little more than barricades that must be removed by paying a certain amount of resources making what passes for combat feel anticlimatic.  In fact beating the levels I did get to left me feeling that way.  I just had big desire to progress onward knowing that all that awaited was more resources to click away at, more monsters that would only cost more to defeat, and more buildings that would require unnecessary micromanaging.  

In fairness, if your looking for something to eat time just slightly funner than staring into empty space, this might work for you.  For the rest of us, I'd take a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979296520', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1392335534}
review:
On first glance, this looks a bit like settlers.

It's not. It feels somewhat like a F2P title that somehow managed to get itself released onto Steam. There's no real fun to be had out of this one, I'm afraid.

Don't get me wrong. It's polished, the music is passable and apart from the slightly pathetic dialogue, it certainly seems functional... But the simple fact that the gameplay boils down to "Click here, watch as the same thing that's happened a hundred dozen times happens again, or don't click here and fail the level" really sort of ruins the experience.

It claims to be a 'fun time management/strategy game'. It's just a giant time-sink... You can practically smell the skinner box.

Don't be fooled by the Settlers-like screenshots. This isn't worth your time. Avoid.
